intro: Calycera crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved calycera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, an adaptation to arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is often found in rocky soils and dry, open habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
